verses.kjv: And there appeared a great wonder in heaven; a woman clothed with the sun, and the moon under her feet, and upon her head a crown of twelve stars:
verses.web: A great sign was seen in heaven: a woman clothed with the sun, and the moon under her feet, and on her head a crown of twelve stars.
verses.ct: Then an incredible sign appeared in heaven: a woman clothed with the sun, with the moon beneath her feet and a crown of 12 stars on her head.

verses.kjv: And she being with child cried, travailing in birth, and pained to be delivered.
verses.web: She was with child. She cried out in pain, laboring to give birth.
verses.ct: She was pregnant and cried out in agony, gripped by the pain of labor as she struggled to give birth.

verses.kjv: And there appeared another wonder in heaven; and behold a great red dragon, having seven heads and ten horns, and seven crowns upon his heads.
verses.web: Another sign was seen in heaven. Behold, a great red dragon, having seven heads and ten horns, and on his heads seven crowns.
verses.ct: Then another sign appeared in heaven: a massive red dragon with 7 heads and 10 horns, wearing 7 crowns on its heads.

verses.kjv: And his tail drew the third part of the stars of heaven, and did cast them to the earth: and the dragon stood before the woman which was ready to be delivered, for to devour her child as soon as it was born.
verses.web: His tail drew one third of the stars of the sky, and threw them to the earth. The dragon stood before the woman who was about to give birth, so that when she gave birth he might devour her child.
verses.ct: Its tail swept a third of the stars out of the sky and hurled them down to the earth. The dragon positioned itself in front of the woman who was about to give birth, ready to devour her child the moment it was born.

verses.kjv: And she brought forth a man child, who was to rule all nations with a rod of iron: and her child was caught up unto God, and to his throne.
verses.web: She gave birth to a son, a male child, who is to rule all the nations with a rod of iron. Her child was caught up to God, and to his throne.
verses.ct: She gave birth to a son — a male child who is destined to rule all nations with a rod of iron. But her child was snatched up to God and to his throne.

verses.kjv: And the woman fled into the wilderness, where she hath a place prepared of God, that they should feed her there a thousand two hundred and threescore days.
verses.web: The woman fled into the wilderness, where she has a place prepared by God, that there they may nourish her one thousand two hundred sixty days.
verses.ct: The woman fled into the wilderness, to a place God had prepared for her, where she would be cared for during 1,260 days.

verses.kjv: And there was war in heaven: Michael and his angels fought against the dragon; and the dragon fought and his angels,
verses.web: There was war in the sky. Michael and his angels made war on the dragon. The dragon and his angels made war.
verses.ct: Then war broke out in heaven. Michael and his angels fought against the dragon, and the dragon and his angels fought back.

verses.kjv: And prevailed not; neither was their place found any more in heaven.
verses.web: They didn’t prevail. No place was found for them any more in heaven.
verses.ct: But the dragon was not strong enough, and there was no longer any place for them in heaven.

verses.kjv: And the great dragon was cast out, that old serpent, called the Devil, and Satan, which deceiveth the whole world: he was cast out into the earth, and his angels were cast out with him.
verses.web: The great dragon was thrown down, the old serpent, he who is called the devil and Satan, the deceiver of the whole world. He was thrown down to the earth, and his angels were thrown down with him.
verses.ct: The great dragon was thrown down — that ancient serpent called the Devil and Satan, who deceives the whole world. He was hurled to the earth, and his angels were thrown down with him.

verses.kjv: And I heard a loud voice saying in heaven, Now is come salvation, and strength, and the kingdom of our God, and the power of his Christ: for the accuser of our brethren is cast down, which accused them before our God day and night.
verses.web: I heard a loud voice in heaven, saying, “Now the salvation, the power, and the Kingdom of our God, and the authority of his Christ has come; for the accuser of our brothers has been thrown down, who accuses them before our God day and night.
verses.ct: Then I heard a loud voice in heaven declare, "Now salvation and power and the kingdom of our God and the authority of his Christ have arrived! The accuser of our brothers and sisters has been thrown down — the one who accused them before our God day and night.

verses.kjv: And they overcame him by the blood of the Lamb, and by the word of their testimony; and they loved not their lives unto the death.
verses.web: They overcame him because of the Lamb’s blood, and because of the word of their testimony. They didn’t love their life, even to death.
verses.ct: They conquered him by the blood of the Lamb and by the word of their testimony. They did not cling to their own lives, even when facing death.

verses.kjv: Therefore rejoice, ye heavens, and ye that dwell in them. Woe to the inhabiters of the earth and of the sea! for the devil is come down unto you, having great wrath, because he knoweth that he hath but a short time.
verses.web: Therefore rejoice, heavens, and you who dwell in them. Woe to the earth and to the sea, because the devil has gone down to you, having great wrath, knowing that he has but a short time.”
verses.ct: So rejoice, you heavens, and everyone who lives in them! But disaster is coming for the earth and the sea, because the devil has come down to you burning with fury, knowing his time is short."

verses.kjv: And when the dragon saw that he was cast unto the earth, he persecuted the woman which brought forth the man child.
verses.web: When the dragon saw that he was thrown down to the earth, he persecuted the woman who gave birth to the male child.
verses.ct: When the dragon realized he had been thrown down to the earth, he went after the woman who had given birth to the male child.

verses.kjv: And to the woman were given two wings of a great eagle, that she might fly into the wilderness, into her place, where she is nourished for a time, and times, and half a time, from the face of the serpent.
verses.web: Two wings of the great eagle were given to the woman, that she might fly into the wilderness to her place, so that she might be nourished for a time, and times, and half a time, from the face of the serpent.
verses.ct: But the woman was given 2 wings of a great eagle so she could fly into the wilderness to the place prepared for her, where she would be nourished for a time, and times, and half a time — far from the serpent's reach.

verses.kjv: And the serpent cast out of his mouth water as a flood after the woman, that he might cause her to be carried away of the flood.
verses.web: The serpent spewed water out of his mouth after the woman like a river, that he might cause her to be carried away by the stream.
verses.ct: The serpent spewed water from its mouth like a river, chasing after the woman, trying to sweep her away in the flood.

verses.kjv: And the earth helped the woman, and the earth opened her mouth, and swallowed up the flood which the dragon cast out of his mouth.
verses.web: The earth helped the woman, and the earth opened its mouth and swallowed up the river which the dragon spewed out of his mouth.
verses.ct: But the earth came to the woman's rescue — it opened up and swallowed the river that the dragon had poured from its mouth.

verses.kjv: And the dragon was wroth with the woman, and went to make war with the remnant of her seed, which keep the commandments of God, and have the testimony of Jesus Christ.
verses.web: The dragon grew angry with the woman, and went away to make war with the rest of her offspring, who keep God’s commandments and hold Jesus’ testimony.
verses.ct: The dragon was enraged at the woman and went off to wage war against the rest of her children — those who obey God's commandments and hold to the testimony of Jesus Christ.
